data.description:
Warp into the twisted world of UPENDERS! and gun your way through this new multiplayer shooter that can only be experienced in VR.


#### GAMEPLAY

* Duck! Dodge! And gun your way through bullet hell shootouts with four different weapon types.

* Use your wits and warp between floors, walls and ceilings to navigate mind bending twisted maps.

* Peer through the your warp scope to surveil surroundings and volley lasers or grenades through the portal at unsuspecting targets!

* Compete in teams with online players and bots in the Domination game mode, where the first team to fill their reactor gauge wins the match, or rack up eliminations in Team Deathmatch

* Make use of the multiverse of equipment at your disposal, including the Blast Shield, Stealth Knife and grenades!

changelog.change_log:
### NEW WEAPON: Stealth Knife
- Eliminate other players with the flick of the wrist with this new melee weapon; a successful elimination incurs a Radiation cost.
- Holding the Stealth Knife with two hands activates its optical camouflage cloaking feature.
- A player can only cloak or remain cloaked when their Radiation gauges are at 0, so a stealth elimination with the knife will briefly reveal the player's position.
- Walking while cloaked will increase your visibility, while standing still makes the player's avatar more transparent, and completely invisible from a ~10 meter distance.
- A successful elimination with the Stealth Knife incurs Radiation.
- The weapon does emit a humming noise, plan your stealth movements carefully if you're going in for a kill.

### New Weapon Skins
- 16 new weapon skins have been added to the game and can be set in the LOADOUT tab of the office space menu.
- We've done away with unlocks, and now all skins are available to all players!

## Click the More Info link to get the latest version of the game!

## Questions? Feeback? Hit us up on Discord: - https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Warp Shot
- Players are now able to fire weapons and throw grenades through the Warp Scope.
- Warp Shots will travel out of the player's Warp Beacon, the orb that indicates their warp destination.
- Warp Beacons have the same vulnerabilities as a player does, except shootign a Warp Beacon will cause its owner to overheat rather than die.
- Warp Beacons also produce an audible humming sound so that other players are aware of the potential threat of a Warp Shot.

### Cosmetic Unlocks
- We are experimenting with an XP system that will allow players to unlock cosmetic items.
- Players who complete a match will be awarded XP based on their team's performance and the percent of the match time in which they participated. (Playing a match from start to finish rewards more XP than starting midway through a match).
- Unlocks can be equippped from the Loadout tab in the Office Space menu.


## Questions? Feeback? Hit us up on Discord: - https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### New Gear: Hand Grenade!
- Hand Grenades are a new type of equipment which are consumable
- Instead of replace a weapon in your hip holster, consumable equipment will be attached to a bandolier on your chest.
- To use a grenade: (1) use the Grip button to grab it from your bandolier, (2) press the A or X button to arm it, and (3) throw or roll the grenade by releasing the Grip button while swinging the controller.
- Hand Grenades have two hit boxes: (1) the explosion hitbox in the middle, which will kill players immediately on collision, and (2) the red-colored radiation field hitbox, which will cause players to overheat on collision.
- Due to game being played on multiple axes, grenades begin their trajectory aligned to the local gravity of the player who threw them. However, when a grenade hits a map obstacle, its gravity will change to match the surface it hit. Sound confusing? Try it out!
- Lastly, you can blow yourself up so BE CAREFUL! 

### Locomotion Collision Fixes
- A major overhaul to the physics of our locomotion system when moving both with thumbsticks and real-world movement.
- Players should no longer get stuck on stairs.
- Thumbstick rotation pivot should now be located directly at the player's feet
- The locomotion collider should no longer become separated from the player's real-world position.

### "Arm-O-Mat" Weapons Cache
- In Team Deathmatch there is now a place to pick up any of the game's weapons directly in front of the player spawn.

## Questions? Feeback? Hit us up on Discord: - https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### New Gear: Blast Shield
- The Blast Shield is a weapon that defaults as a handheld shield.
- Pulling the trigger button will fire large but slow, short range projectiles.
- Players will incur radiation when the Blast Shield fires projectiles and absorbs enemy projectiles.
- If a player overheats, the shield component of this weapon will be disabled.

### Achievements (Test)
- We are currently testing an achievements system.
- You can view available achievements and check your progress in the AGENT PROFILE tab of the Office Space menu.
- Your Player Stats are now called Career Stats, and can be accessed from the AGENT PROFILE tab.

### UI Updates
- The in-game scoreboard and menu can now be accessed by holding down the B or Y buttons. Releasing the buttons will hide it.
- A match log is now available on the right side of the in-game menu, displaying kills and objectives as they happen.
- You can now see your teammate's name badge through walls, and names are color coded by team.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Warp Gloves
- Warping is no longer accomplished with the holstered 'Warp Device' equipment.
- Instead, pressing the GRIP button with either hand while empty handed will show the warp cursor. From this point operation is unchanged.

### Akimbo / Dual Wield
- By adding the the warp glove feature we have freed up one of the holsters for a second weapon.
- Players begin the match with two standard Gravgun pistols
- When a player picks up a new weapon, it will replace the weapon in the holster associated with the hand they used to pick up the new weapon.
- Grabbing the weapon in the opposite holster will swap each holster's weapons.

### Refreshed Tutorial
- The tutorial has been modified to include the above changes.
- All players will be sent to the tutorial on the first boot.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Weekly & All Time Leaderboards
- The Leaderboard tab is back! You can view your all-time or weekly standing by selecting this tab in the Office Space menu.
- The buttons at the bottom of the Leaderboard panel will toggle between the Weekly and All-Time views.
- Your leaderboard score is now a cumulative value rather than a high score; currently it is entirely additive, with no loss of score points.
- Instead of a discrete view for Top 10 and your own 'local' standing we will show the top 10 players at the top of each Leaderboard view, and then your local standing (your rank and that of 4 adjacent players) right below that.


! We are still in the middle of debugging this, so we would appreciate any feedback regarding leaderboard accuracy.
! While debugging this new implementation, we found some ancient MVP rewarding bugs that attributed MVPs to the wrong player's Player Stats.
  For this reason MVP counts have been reset.
! Best Match Score has also been reset due to changes in our scoring algorithms.

### MVP Reward Effect
- If a player receives MVP in a match, the MVP badge will appear above their head in the Results Room.

### Bug Fixes
- Fixed an MVP accounting error in the Player Stats API.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Smoother Thumbstick Locomotion
- We have updated the physics refresh rate in the game which drastically improves thumbstick locomotion's presentation.

! One caveat is that this does have a non-trivial performance overhead. First generation Quest users are already effected by the rendering overhead that is mainly caused by the Warp Scope feature. While this update will improve locomotion in most situations we are still working on bringing parity to the Quest 1 experience. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

### Gravity Pistol
Early players and testers (and unlucky players who may have glitched into our test environment) may remember that the default pistol's projectiles used to ricochet off of obstacles. We've re-implemented this feature and adjusted the pistol's radiation cost to give the old standard its own gimmicky gunplay.

### Parameter Adjustments
- Faster respawn for both human player and bots.
- 2 minute domination time for all domination maps.

### Tutorial Adjustment
- Adjusted text instructions and environment assets in the "Using the Wrist Device" step of the tutorial in hopes of clearing up where players need to go and what they need to do. 

### Bug Fixes
- Fixed a bug which caused some players to get locked into a black screen when starting the tutorial from the Office Space menu when they have inadequate internet connection.
- Fixed a bug by which players wouldn't be able to complete the tutorial if they skipped certain steps.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Room Code Update
After crunching some usage statistics and getting community feedback we determined that players want to both play with their friends and in discoverable public matches, so the following changes have been made:

- All games can now be joined using a 4-digit room code by selecting the "Use a Room Code" option under the Find A Game tab in the office space.
- All games now have 4-digit room codes, whether chosen by a player or generated automatically by Quick Match when vacancies can't be found in active games.
- Quick Match can now discover all active games to reduce the number of lonely lobbies.

We do understand that were some players who enjoyed practicing alone in private rooms. If this is something you feel strongly about please let us know in our Discord server's #feedback channel.

### Custom Games
- If a player enters an unused 4-digit room code after clicking the "Use a Room Code" button they can also choose or randomize which game mode and map they will start in.

### Smooth Turning
Several reviewers and community members have requested Smooth Turning as an immersion feature, but also more importantly as an accessibility feature, so we've added this option to the game.

- A 'Turning Mode' toggle has been added to the Options tab in the office space menu allowing the player to select between 'Snap' and 'Smooth'.
- If Smooth turning is toggled, you can adjust its speed with the 'Smooth Turn Speed' toggle.


### Bug Fixes
- Fixed a bug that caused teams to get stacked if too many players join the same match at exactly the same time.
- Fixed a bug that caused players to spawn in the same spawn point.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Bot Count Scaling
- The total number of players and bots should not exceed 3 per team now.

### Pacing Adjustment Test
We've made some parameter changes to see what the game feels like with faster pacing.
- Thumbstick locomotion speed and bullet speed have been increased by 10~15%
- Bullet "collision barriers" are no longer generated when bullets collide with one another

### Bug Fix
- Fixed a bug where Team Switching could sometimes result in 1 vs (3,  4 or 5) team distributions.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Bot Count Scaling
- The total number of players and bots should not exceed 3 per team now.

### Pacing Adjustment Test
We've made some parameter changes to see what the game feels like with faster pacing.
- Thumbstick locomotion speed and bullet speed have been increased by 10~15%
- Bullet "collision barriers" are no longer generated when bullets collide with one another

### ! Known Bugs !
There is a known bug whereby teams will become stacked (one player vs everyone else) if the master client (host) of a lobby is the only player who picks a new team between matches. We are working on finding the cause, but if you experience this please let us know on the Discord server, linked below.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Bug Fixes
- Fixed a bug that would sometimes disallow players to speak or hear voice chat
  * Players can now verify whether they themselves are speaking in voice chat by viewing their own speaker icon in the Scoreboard
- Fixed a bug that would strand players in the Results Room if they joined a lobby right as the next match was starting
- Minor security patch due to a vulnerability that was brought to our attention by the Oculus build tester in v31

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

We've added a team switching function so that players can better customize their competitive experience. This is a small, incremental but important update as we slowly add more match customization to our player experience. 

### Team Switching Controls
- Players can now switch teams in the Match Result room between matches.
- If any player change teams between matches, the auto team balancing feature will be cancelled.
- The number of players on each team in the next match will be displayed above the team's icon
- If the player hovers their cursor over the team player count, a tool tip will show which members are assigned to that team.

### Scoreboard UI Improvements
- The scoring icons above each column will now display tool tips if the player hovers their cursor over them to explain the values represented by each icon.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Bot Patch
- Bot dodging behavior, player-awareness and field of vision adjusted for difficulty balancing.
- Bot count reduced to 3 per team.

### Scoreboard Patches
- Result Room Scoreboard now displays which team won and which team lost.
- MVP badge position adjusted for better readability.

### Bug Fixes
- Repaired visual bug where non-glowing enemies were visible behind walls through the warp scope.
- Miscellaneous scoring bugs fixed.
- Stage background music playback bugs fixed.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

### Team Deathmatch Game Mode
- A new game mode where players shoot it out until either one team reaches the total Kills goal or the match time runs out.
- Player and Bot kills both contribute to the team score.

### Map and Game Mode Voting
- Now at the end of each match you can vote on which map and game mode you and your matchmates will play.
- Team Switching will also be available in this interface very soon.
- For the time being this is only accessible at the -end- of each match; we will work on a solution for custom matches in the lobby in a future update.

### Bot-O-Mat
- Bots no longer replace your teammates, but are instead are generated in dedicated 'Bot-O-Mat' spawn boxes.
- Bot-O-Mats will spawn a new bot after its current bot is eliminated.
- For the time being, Bot-O-Mats continue to function even when more players join the match so players may have to watch out for both bots and players and tread more carefully.

### In-Game Scoreboard Refresh
- The In-Game Scoreboard is now accessible while waiting to respawn by pressing the Menu button on your left Touch Controller.
- Game time and score are now displayed at the top of the In-Game Scoreboard
- Columns have been changed to icons for a more compact, side-by-side form factor

### Match Results Scoreboard Refresh
- The layout has been adjusted similar to the In-Game Scoreboard.
- The time and score from the end of the match is now displayed at the top so you know how your team did.

### Scoring Formula Adjustments
- Players are given a base score depending on whether the result of the match is a win, loss or draw.
- Each player is given a performance bonus based on their Kills, Bot Kills, Objective Score contribution, minus a Death Count penalty.
- The players with the best performance on each team is awarded an MVP bonus.
- Finally, scores are modified based on percent of the match played, favoring those who play matches start to finish.

# Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

[0.1.24]
Shipwreck Map Refresh
- Two new sub-routes have been opened up on Shipwreck:
   * The first is a plank extending from the left route's sniper perch which should allow players to get a better view of the map, as well warp to the platforms that flank the control point.
   * Some obstacles were also added to the sniper perch to reduce spawn camping.
   * The second is a second story platform between the right route's initial crate cover area and the control point area. This allows for more free traversal on the reverse-Y plane.
- Some additional lighting elements were added to help add points of interest for stage navigation.

Parameter Adjustments
- Respawn time has been reduced by 30%
- Overheat time has been reduced by 40%
- Bullet hit boxes are slightly smaller (10cm -> 7.5 cm radius) to allow passage through narrow areas, especially useful for the Targeting Pistol. This also means that bullets should be slightly easier to dodge.

Minor Visual Adjustments
- Lightmaps and fog have been adjusted for map readability
- The glowing border on the Warp Scope has been made thicker and brighter so it is easier to distinguish between the Warp Scope and the player's primary field of vision. 
- Miscellaneous aesthetic adjustments

Bugs
- A bug where the head-tracked UIs (First Spawn dialog, Respawn dialog, Elimination dialog) moved choppily while walking has been fixed.

Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

[0.1.23]
Results Room Scoreboard
- Added a new global scoreboard to the Results Room at the end of the match.
  [!] We are currently modifying our scoring methods, so for the time being the Leaderboard in the Office Lobby has been disabled.

Voice Chat Controls Modification
- The 'Global', 'Team' and 'Off' voice chat toggles found in the Options menu and Scoreboard menu now toggle both microphone and speaker channels. So the expected behavior is:
   * Players on the same team should always be able to hear each other, except if either player's toggle is set to 'Off'
   * Players on opposite teams should only ever be able to hear each other if both players' toggles are set to 'Global'
   * You can still selectively mute other players by clicking the speaker icon beside their name in the Scoreboard menu.
- The in-game music's volume will now dampen when players speak over voice chat.

Minor Visual Improvements
- Changes to laser shader to make team color more readable.
- Changes to the rim lighting / fresnel glow term in the character and environment shaders to eliminate "flicker" at the edges of models.
- Fixed bug in bot's "eye" shader which made it visible even while the bot isn't glowing. 

Bugs
- Fixed a bug where players who had been killed just before a match ends would spawn outside of the match Results Room.
- Various minor backend bug fixes.

Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

[0.1.22]
Bugs
- Fixed a bug in our new tutorial steps whereby players were able to skip steps and break the tutorial loop.
- Various minor backend bug fixes.

Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

[0.1.21]
Warp Device Improvements
- The warp device now more accurately translates the player's starting rotation to the warp scope's starting rotation. It's hard to explain if you haven't played the game yet, but trust me: it is GOOD!
- The warp portal and warp particle effect now have a fancy new look.

Tutorial Improvements
- New steps have been added to the tutorial to better explain radiation/overheat and two-handed weapon operation.

Bugs
- Fixed a bug in which the thumbstick rotation rotates players on an offset axis, causing them to rotate into mid air or into walls.

Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

[0.1.20]
Voice Controls : Microphone Channel
- Players can now change their microphone channel from Global to Team in the in-game SCOREBOARD menu, or in the OPTIONS menu in the Lobby. Players may also turn the microphone off with this feature.

Voice Chat Status Icons
- Each player's voice chat status is displayed with an icon beside their names both above their avatars and on the in-game SCOREBOARD.
- This icon will change color depending on whether the player is speaking in the global or team channels or when they have their microphone off.
- The icons displayed on the in-game SCOREBOARD also double as a mute button, allowing players to mute online players locally.

Got feedback? Check out our Discord server : https://discord.gg/vDqqJBSejd

[0.1.19]
Updates
- "Pipe Hell" and "Gothic Spires" maps have been adjusted for a two (2) control point Domination game mode.
- Various changes to matchmaking logic to address network related bugs (see below).
- The Results Room between matches now shows the name of the next map and time until load.

Bug Fixes
Fixes have been implemented to address the following bugs:
- Players entering the same private room code within a certain time window would sometimes end up in different rooms.
- New players who tried to join a Quick Match while an existing game was in the Results Room would end up in a room by themselves.
- A variety of bugs resulting in players being unable to load the Results Room at the end of a match due to network latency issues.
- Bots and players that would not die or take damage due to desynchronization of a match's player records
